verses.esv:
15   Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep,
    and an idle person will suffer hunger.
verses.kjv: 15 Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.
verses.niv: 15 Laziness brings on deep sleep, and the shiftless man goes hungry.

verses.esv: 10 For even when we were with you, we would give you this command: If anyone is not willing to work, let him not eat.
verses.kjv: 10 For even when we were with you, this we commanded you, that if any would not work, neither should he eat.
verses.niv: 10 For even when we were with you, we gave you this rule: "If a man will not work, he shall not eat."

verses.esv:
24   The hand of the diligent will rule,
    while the slothful will be put to forced labor.
verses.kjv: 24 The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.
verses.niv: 24 Diligent hands will rule, but laziness ends in slave labor.

verses.esv:
4   The soul of the sluggard craves and gets nothing,
    while the soul of the diligent is richly supplied.
verses.kjv: 4 The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
verses.niv: 4 The sluggard craves and gets nothing, but the desires of the diligent are fully satisfied.

verses.esv:
6   Go to the ant, O sluggard;
    consider her ways, and be wise.
verses.kjv: 6 Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:
verses.niv: 6 Go to the ant, you sluggard; consider its ways and be wise!

verses.esv:
4   The sluggard does not plow in the autumn;
    he will seek at harvest and have nothing.
verses.kjv: 4 The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.
verses.niv: 4 A sluggard does not plow in season; so at harvest time he looks but finds nothing.

verses.esv:
30   I passed by the field of a sluggard,
    by the vineyard of a man lacking sense,
31   and behold, it was all overgrown with thorns;
    the ground was covered with nettles,
    and its stone wall was broken down.
32   Then I saw and considered it;
    I looked and received instruction.
33   A little sleep, a little slumber,
    a little folding of the hands to rest,
34   and poverty will come upon you like a robber,
    and want like an armed man.
verses.kjv: 30 I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding; 31 And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down. 32 Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction. 33 Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep: 34 So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth; and thy want as an armed man.
verses.niv: 30 I went past the field of the sluggard, past the vineyard of the man who lacks judgment; 31 thorns had come up everywhere, the ground was covered with weeds, and the stone wall was in ruins. 32 I applied my heart to what I observed and learned a lesson from what I saw: 33 A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest- 34 and poverty will come on you like a bandit and scarcity like an armed man.

verses.esv:
18   Through sloth the roof sinks in,
    and through indolence the house leaks.
verses.kjv: 18 By much slothfulness the building decayeth; and through idleness of the hands the house droppeth through.
verses.niv: 18 If a man is lazy, the rafters sag; if his hands are idle, the house leaks.

verses.esv:
24   The sluggard buries his hand in the dish
    and will not even bring it back to his mouth.
verses.kjv: 24 A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
verses.niv: 24 The sluggard buries his hand in the dish; he will not even bring it back to his mouth!

verses.esv: 23 Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men,
verses.kjv: 23 And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
verses.niv: 23 Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for men,

verses.esv: 11 Do not be slothful in zeal, be fervent in spirit, serve the Lord.
verses.kjv: 11 Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;
verses.niv: 11 Never be lacking in zeal, but keep your spiritual fervor, serving the Lord.

verses.esv:
25   The desire of the sluggard kills him,
    for his hands refuse to labor.
verses.kjv: 25 The desire of the slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labour.
verses.niv: 25 The sluggard's craving will be the death of him, because his hands refuse to work.

verses.esv:
13   The sluggard says, “There is a lion outside!
    I shall be killed in the streets!”
verses.kjv: 13 The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.
verses.niv: 13 The sluggard says, "There is a lion outside!" or, "I will be murdered in the streets!"

verses.esv:
9   Whoever is slack in his work
    is a brother to him who destroys.
verses.kjv: 9 He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.
verses.niv: 9 One who is slack in his work is brother to one who destroys.

verses.esv:
19   The way of a sluggard is like a hedge of thorns,
    but the path of the upright is a level highway.
verses.kjv: 19 The way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous is made plain.
verses.niv: 19 The way of the sluggard is blocked with thorns, but the path of the upright is a highway.

verses.esv:
4   A slack hand causes poverty,
    but the hand of the diligent makes rich.
verses.kjv: 4 He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
verses.niv: 4 Lazy hands make a man poor, but diligent hands bring wealth.

verses.esv:
13   The sluggard says, “There is a lion in the road!
    There is a lion in the streets!”
14   As a door turns on its hinges,
    so does a sluggard on his bed.
15   The sluggard buries his hand in the dish;
    it wears him out to bring it back to his mouth.
16   The sluggard is wiser in his own eyes
    than seven men who can answer sensibly.
verses.kjv: 13 The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets. 14 As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed. 15 The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth. 16 The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.
verses.niv: 13 The sluggard says, "There is a lion in the road, a fierce lion roaming the streets!" 14 As a door turns on its hinges, so a sluggard turns on his bed. 15 The sluggard buries his hand in the dish; he is too lazy to bring it back to his mouth. 16 The sluggard is wiser in his own eyes than seven men who answer discreetly.

verses.esv: 12 so that you may not be sluggish, but imitators of those who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
verses.kjv: 12 That ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
verses.niv: 12 We do not want you to become lazy, but to imitate those who through faith and patience inherit what has been promised.

verses.esv: 8 But if anyone does not provide for his relatives, and especially for members of his household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
verses.kjv: 8 But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.
verses.niv: 8 If anyone does not provide for his relatives, and especially for his immediate family, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.

verses.esv:
27   Whoever is slothful will not roast his game,
    but the diligent man will get precious wealth.
verses.kjv: 27 The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is precious.
verses.niv: 27 The lazy man does not roast his game, but the diligent man prizes his possessions.

verses.esv:
26   Like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes,
    so is the sluggard to those who send him.
verses.kjv: 26 As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.
verses.niv: 26 As vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, so is a sluggard to those who send him.

verses.esv: 26 But his master answered him, ‘You wicked and slothful servant! You knew that I reap where I have not sown and gather where I scattered no seed?
verses.kjv: 26 His lord answered and said unto him, Thou wicked and slothful servant, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I have not strawed:
verses.niv: 26 "His master replied, 'You wicked, lazy servant! So you knew that I harvest where I have not sown and gather where I have not scattered seed?

verses.esv: 17 And whatever you do, in word or deed, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.
verses.kjv: 17 And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.
verses.niv: 17 And whatever you do, whether in word or deed, do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.

verses.esv:
30   I passed by the field of a sluggard,
    by the vineyard of a man lacking sense,
verses.kjv: 30 I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;
verses.niv: 30 I went past the field of the sluggard, past the vineyard of the man who lacks judgment;

verses.esv: 10 Love one another with brotherly affection. Outdo one another in showing honor. 11 Do not be slothful in zeal, be fervent in spirit, serve the Lord.
verses.kjv: 10 Be kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another; 11 Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;
verses.niv: 10 Be devoted to one another in brotherly love. Honor one another above yourselves. 11 Never be lacking in zeal, but keep your spiritual fervor, serving the Lord.
